result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Robert Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1 and 2 to run concurrent.
Defendant to report to Probation June 9, 2015 by 3:30 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 4 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 2

miscConds.notes:
Court will add costs to Defendant's current payment plan.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Continue with mental health treatment until successfully discharged.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with H.A.A. dob 5/16/1978.
-Defendant to sign up with the Sex Offender Registration through Probation for a period of 15 years.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Fr DE re: SDCNI rec'd stating he made pymt. Ret'd call to DE & advised him he missed his May 10th pymt, so he was sent the Coll (SDC) notice. DE was advised that we did receive his May pymt on 5/26/20 & his final pymt of $22.13 is due by 6/10/20. DE stated he is pd on 6/9/20 & will make pymt by the next day, likely in person. jaf
30 day SDCNI notice sent this date. jaf

Order for payment on November 11, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
DE mailed copy on this date. jaf
PPA reinstated upon pymt. DE to pay $25/mo comm 11-10-19. DE to be turned over to SDC if any add'l pymts are missed. DE will be mailed a courtesy copy of his amended Order for Pymt. jaf

From DE on 10-28-19 @ 2pm stating he rec'd the SDCNI, forgot to make pymt, & would like to know how to resolve. Ret'd call to DE today & left a v/m stating that he may make a $25 pymt to make him current & we will reinstate his Pymt Plan for this 1 x only.  DE was also advised that if he were to miss another pymt or make pymt untimely, we will turn his debt over to Coll (SDC) immediately. DE was reminded that if he does make his $25 pymt to make him current, his next pymt will then be due by 11-10-19. DE to ret my call if he has add'l questions. jaf

Order for payment on September 16, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
DE mailed copy on this date. jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: Chad Robert Simpson appeared.  Court called at 3:13 p.m.  Set for SEH.  Court has reviewed the COMPAS Evaluation and the Medical Evaluation.  Attorneys make sentencing arguments for Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 14CF408.  DE makes statement.  Crt. orders:

Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 to run concurrent sentences
S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- AODA with follow through  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   Continue with mental health treatment until DE is successfully discharged if ever
-   It is hereby ordered, that the defendant have absolutely NO CONTACT with the following named persons, H.A.A. with a D/O/B of 05/146/78.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- DE to sign up with the Sex Offender Registration through probation for a period of 15 years
- Court costs of $536.00 and a one time cost of $250 for the DNA Surcharge
- Court will add costs to the DEs current payment plan
- DE to sign up with probation by 3:30 p.m. tomorrow
- Bail is continued until DE signs up for probation 
- Credit for 4 days jail if DE is revoked
- 20 days to appeal
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Erin Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF:  Chad Robert Simpson appeared.  Court called at 3:10 p.m.  Includes case 14CF408 & 15CF40.  Set for STC.    ADA Nieskes advises the court there is an agreement but want time to contact the victim and have a COMPAS done on the DE.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to amended Ct 1 in 14CF408.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 2 in 14CF408.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of the amended Ct 1 & Ct. 2 in 14CF408.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15CF40.  Crt orders the DE to undergo a COMPAS Evaluation.  Crt will schedule for SEH.  Bail will continue until the sentencing.  Court adjourned at 3:31 p.m. lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, H.A.A. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Chad Robert Simpson appeared from jail. Defendant is unable to post the bond. Court modifies bond. Speedy prelim waived. Atty Kucinski states Defendant would like his money & phone back from the Sheriff. ADA Sortedahl opposses the request. Atty Kucinski to put the request in writing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
